Dental clinics, physiotherapy centers, and pharmacies are abundant in the town. The Spanish healthcare system is efficient and cost-effective, with many expats supplementing with comprehensive private insurance. Medical appointments are straightforward to arrange, and prescription medications are readily available and affordable.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners enjoy identical property ownership rights as Spanish citizens. Non-residents require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which is straightforward to obtain. No visa or residency is required for property purchase. Most purchase transactions involve qualified Spanish lawyers who handle all legal requirements, making the process secure and transparent.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect: Transfer Tax (6-10% depending on region), Notary fees (0.5-1%), Registry fees (0.1-0.3%), and legal fees (1-2%). Total acquisition costs typically range 8-13% of purchase price. Annual costs include Property Tax (0.4-1.1%), community fees if applicable, and optional insurance. Rental income is subject to 19% Spanish income tax if non-resident.

faqs.question: Сколько составляет налог на недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Property Tax (Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) ranges from 0.4-1.1% of property value annually, varying by municipality. El Verger rates are competitive. Community fees for apartment complexes typically range €50-150 monthly depending on amenities. Non-residents declaring rental income pay 19% tax on gross rental revenue. These costs are manageable and transparent, with many owners structuring ownership efficiently through tax planning.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically covering 60-80% of property value. Requirements include proof of income, identification documents, and property valuation. Interest rates are competitive, often 2-4% for fixed-rate mortgages. Non-residents may face slightly stricter requirements, but mortgages are routinely available. Spanish lawyers can recommend qualified mortgage brokers familiar with foreign buyer procedures.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent value-for-money living. Monthly expenses for a couple range €1,200-1,800 including groceries, utilities, dining out, and activities. Supermarket prices are 20-30% less than UK equivalents. Local dining is affordable—quality meals €10-15 per person. Healthcare costs for supplementary insurance are minimal. Property taxes and community fees are modest. Many expatriates report reducing overall living costs compared to northern Europe.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Costa Blanca experiences over 300 days of sunshine annually with average temperatures of 18°C in winter and 27°C in summer. Mediterranean climate means mild winters without harsh cold and hot summers tempered by sea breezes. Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring months. This consistent, pleasant weather enables year-round beach activities, outdoor dining, and retirement planning. El Verger's location provides ideal climate without extreme summer heat affecting some inland areas.
